snippet: Aereo hopes to offer an alternative for viewers who prefer to grab their favorite shows piecemeal from a number of online sources.
abstract: Start-up Aereo picks up local broadcast channels and streams them over the Internet to mobile devices and TV sets, with subscribers paying fees starting at $8 a month; it hopes to offer an alternative for viewers who prefer to grab their favorite shows piecemeal from a number of online sources.

headline.main: For a Fee, Streaming Local TV
headline.print_headline: For a Fee, Streaming Local TV

snippet: The iPhone 5 that Apple introduced last week with only incremental changes seemed to signal that the smartphone industry has entered an era of technological bunny hops.
abstract: Apple's iPhone 5, introduced with only incremental changes, seems to signal that the smartphone industry has entered an era of technological bunny hops; refinements lack the breathtaking impact the first iPhone had in 2007, but incremental improvements can add up over years; breakthroughs in materials and software could lead to substantial changes in how they look and function in the future.

headline.main: Despite a Slowdown, Smartphone Advances Are Still Ahead

snippet: Silicon Valley would like the world to think it doesn't care about money. But these start-ups aren't nonprofit organizations.
abstract: Silicon Valley would like the world to think it doesn't care about money. But these start-ups aren't nonprofit organizations.

headline.main: Disruptions: Let Silicon Valley Eat ... Ramen Noodles?
headline.print_headline: Disruptions: A Silicon Valley Sport: Playing Down Wealth

snippet: You're trying to be a good mom. In fact, you are a good mom. That's the problem. Your enthusiasm is killing my buzz.
abstract: You're trying to be a good mom. In fact, you are a good mom. That's the problem. Your enthusiasm is killing my buzz.

headline.main: To the Mom Who Can't Stop Following Her Child Around the Playground

snippet: Some Web browsers have been offering “do not track” options for users who prefer not to have their activity tracked for marketing. Microsoft is taking the idea even further.
abstract: Natasha Singer Slipstream column on Web browsers that offer 'do not track' options for users who prefer not to have their activity tracked for marketing; notes Microsoft's Internet Explorer 10 browser, which comes with do-not-track-me option automatically enabled; cites industry analysts who say if millions of consumers opt out of behavior-based advertising, many ad-sponsored sites could shut down or put up pay walls for people who elect not to see the ads.

headline.main: When the Privacy Button Is Already Pressed
headline.print_headline: When the Privacy Button Is Already Pressed

snippet: The economy could benefit from two very different events last week: the announcement of the Federal Reserve’s latest bond-buying plan and Apple’s introduction of the iPhone 5.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column holds the economy could benefit from two very different events: Federal Reserve's announcement of its latest bond-buying plan and Apple’s introduction of the iPhone 5; maintains Fed's ambitious plan is by far the riskiest of the two, and Apple, by contrast, is operating from a position of strength.

headline.main: Kick-Starts From a Phone and the Fed
headline.print_headline: Kick-Starts From a Phone and the Fed

snippet: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island.
Timbre, an app that came out this month, presents the user with a simple list of bands playing nearby and provides samples of the music.
abstract: App City column on Timbre, iPhone app by Intrepid Pursuits that tells users what concerts are happening nearby.

headline.main: A Concert Finder for the Open-Minded
headline.print_headline: A Concert Finder for the Open-Minded

snippet: Even as the “Made in the U.S.A.” label has grown scarce, it has acquired cachet as a signifier of old-school craftsmanship, even luxury.
abstract: 'Made in the USA' label--now a rarity due to offshore manufacturing in apparel--has acquired cachet as a signifier of craftsmanship and even luxury; Made, a new company that both sells American-made goods online and helps other companies that only manufacture in America advertise, is seeking to capitalize on this growing trend.

headline.main: A Label That Has Regained Its Luster
headline.print_headline: A Label That Has Regained Its Luster

snippet: The scores, or hundreds even, of events, during the New York Fashion Week continuum made it feel that one had wandered into a glossier version of “Groundhog Day.”
abstract: Guy Trebay Fashion Diary column describes the highlights at scores of events and parties held during New York Fashion Week
